bullets.text: Tariff threats and a Trump post erased roughly $2 trillion in U.S. market value, amplifying volatility ahead of key tech earnings.
Shutdown impacts widen as layoffs mount; Trump says funds identified to pay troops, hardening standoff and policy uncertainty.
Federal judges warn of a judicial crisis, criticizing Supreme Court’s expanding emergency orders that bypass normal briefing and transparency.
Israelis rally for hostages as Gazans return north under cease-fire, confronting vast destruction; intelligence trove details Hamas’s Oct. 7 planning.
BlackRock flags rotation within AI trade, with investor flows favoring bitcoin and differentiated AI exposures over crowded mega-cap plays.
OpenAI’s dominance and rapid enterprise AI adoption reshape competitive dynamics and capital allocation across Silicon Valley and incumbents.
Berkshire’s Japan equity bets top $30 billion, boosting exposure to exporters and yen-diversified cash flows.
Activist Irenic takes stake in Atkore, urging a strategic review and potential sale to unlock value.
Ray Dalio advocates 15% gold allocation; advisors debate diversification benefits versus opportunity cost amid elevated volatility and policy risk.
S&P 500 index funds face concentration risk near historical extremes, heightening drawdown vulnerability if megacap earnings or policy shocks disappoint.
Solid-state transformer designs promise faster, higher-power EV charging with improved grid integration, potentially accelerating adoption and infrastructure scalability.
Indonesia reports cesium-137 contamination at 22 plants near Jakarta, spotlighting industrial safety and radiological monitoring gaps.
McDonald’s revives Monopoly promotion with $1 million giveaway; analysts expect traffic and same-store sales lift amid value-seeking consumers.
Scientists identify specific brain cell populations linked to depression, enabling targeted therapies and biomarker development.
